Line0.name: Fifi
Line0.dialogue: My school is the only one that isn't off because of the cuarintine

Line1.name: Fifi
Line1.dialogue: Screw them, there are already over a hundred dead in my state alone. i don't want to be a fucking statistic.

Line2.name: Fifi
Line2.dialogue: But i'll probably lose some classes

Line3.name: Fifi
Line3.dialogue: i just need to take my mind off these things, i'll go with old man Old Snowball, he always clears my mind up

Line9.name: Old Snowball
Line9.dialogue: well hello Fifi, What brings you here so early, usually you don't come till late in the evening

Line10.name: Fifi
Line10.dialogue: I didn't feel up for school today

Line11.name: Fifi
Line11.dialogue: i wanted to finally hear the story about how you met your baby here

Line12.name: Old Snowball
Line12.dialogue: Aye, this old train has watched over me well

Line13.name: Old Snowball
Line13.dialogue: Okay, here goes the story, but it puts me sentimental, so listen closely the first time

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: What do you want?

Option0.Head: Isn't the train supposed to be on by now?

Option1.Head: I used to be a Machinist

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: Isn't the train supposed to be on by now?

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: I was just checking on the passengers, we'll be out shortly

Line2.name: Machinist
Line2.dialogue: Anything else?

Option1.Head: I used to be a machinist

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: I used to be a machinist myself

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: Used to? Now what do you do?

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: I'm on my way to make a new railway, maybe your train will ride it

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: This here train is on it's last voyage, after this it's off to the scrapyard

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: This here train is on it's last voyage, after this it's off to the scrapyard

Line6.name: Machinist
Line6.dialogue: sometimes a young guy gets on the train, or hitchs a ride, and they need a job, or they're running from something, or maybe they're lost and just give up, in the force we call them easy fallers

Line7.name: Machinist
Line7.dialogue: sometimes a young guy gets on the train, or hitchs a ride, and they need a job, or they're running from something, or maybe they're lost and just give up, in the force we call them easy fallers

Option1.Head: How does one get a job like this?

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: That sounds horrible!

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: Yep, but you can change jobs after a while, i was a brakeman for decades before i became a machinist

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: You where an easy faller?, what happened?

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: I liked trains, one day I got lost on a train without my mom when I was a young boy

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: When the train finally got to central station they just gave me an uniform and told me I was theirs

Line5.name: Snowball
Line5.dialogue: Your poor mother, she must have been devestaded

Line6.name: Machinist
Line6.dialogue: Either they told her i was dead, or she was happy she had one less mouth to feed, because i haven't seen her since

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: How does one get a job like this?

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: Just do what i did

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: what happend with you?

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: I liked trains, one day I got lost on a train without my mom when I was a young boy

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: When the train finally got to central station they just gave me an uniform and told me I was theirs

Line5.name: Snowball
Line5.dialogue: Did your mother just not care

Line6.name: Machinist
Line6.dialogue: Either they told her I was dead, or she was happy she had one less mouth to feed, because I haven't seen her since

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: I'm busy pal, come at another time

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: What now?

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: I took a child with a writer on board

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: to listen to some stories since he was a bit sad

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: just passing the time now

Line7.name: Machinist
Line7.dialogue: Well you should get going, it's not safe over here

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: What are you doing here?

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: You already know it's dangerous

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: Have you seen a boy?

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: We've lost him and I said I would be responsible for his safety

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: Well I haven't seen him pass through here, you should check the roof

Line5.name: Machinist
Line5.dialogue: Maybe he went up trying to see what his dad did

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: I'm surprised you didn't die on the roof

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: You found him yet?

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: You disgusting sick degenerate piece of sub-feline filth

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: What?

Option0.Head: is the boy just another prospective worker for you?

Line0.name: Machinist
Line0.dialogue: The boy?

Line1.name: Machinist
Line1.dialogue: I saved him

Line2.name: Machinist
Line2.dialogue: He was running around on the roof wanting to die like his father

Line3.name: Machinist
Line3.dialogue: I brought him down, i saved his life, a life that would have been lost

Line4.name: Machinist
Line4.dialogue: Now he's mine, and the companys to use as we see fit

Line5.name: Snowball
Line5.dialogue: You sick freak, where is he

Line6.name: Machinist
Line6.dialogue: Shoveling coal in the engine room, getting used to his new life

Line7.name: Snowball
Line7.dialogue: You bastard, tell me where he is or I will punch the truth out of you!

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: This train sure is taking it's time isn't it?

Option0.Head: I imagine the train has it's reasons

Option1.Head: It ireally is, it's quite strange

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: someone should go see if the machinist isn't sleeping

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: Well, they didn't lie when they said that this isn't a luxury cabin

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: At least it's better than the roof

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: I guess it is

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: And what are you doing in this first class transport

Line3.name: Widow
Line3.dialogue: On my way to the central station, going to cash some money my husband was owed, pay rent, pay for my sons college

Line4.name: Widow
Line4.dialogue: Maybe get some new shoes with it

Line5.name: Snowball
Line5.dialogue: He worked for the company then?

Line6.name: Widow
Line6.dialogue: On this very train, he was a brakeman for 35 years

Option0.Head: Why didn't he ever switch jobs?

Option1.Head: He must've had a death wish, or is a really brave man

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: He didn't want anybody else to risk life and limb like that

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Like he did

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: He is an extremely brave man

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: It's better than the roof

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: I guess it is

Option0.Head: And what are you doing in this first class seating?

Option1.Head: Your son said something about hist father

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: On my way to the central station, going to cash some money my husbands owed, pay rent, pay my sons college

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Maybe get some new shoes with it

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: He worked for the company then?

Line3.name: Widow
Line3.dialogue: On this very train, he was a brakeman for 35 years

Option0.Head: Why didn't he ever switch jobs?

Option1.Head: He must've had a death wish, or is a really brave man

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: He didn't want anybody else to risk life and limb like that

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Like he did

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: He is an extremely brave man

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: A couple months back he was working a night shift, and there was a storm..

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: You don't have to go on, I'm terribly sorry for your lost, he sounds like he was a good man

Line3.name: Widow
Line3.dialogue: He was and still is

Line4.name: Widow
Line4.dialogue: He never cashed that debt with us in mind

Line4.name: Widow
Line4.dialogue: He wanted to leave something behind in case anything ever happend to him

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: Hello kind man

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Hello

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: I was just talking with a childrens book writer that's onboard

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: And well, i thought that maybe it'd cheer up your son to be told a story

Line5.name: Widn
Line5.dialogue: I'll consider him in good hands if you watch over him

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: How is my little boy doing?

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Perfectly, he's great

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: Can you tell my son to hurry up?

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Yeah, sure thing

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: It's about time he get's back, or at least tells me how he's doing

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: So when is he coming back, i'm starting to get nervous

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: But don't panic, i'll find him and bring him here safe and sound, the train isn't that large after all

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: You lost my child?

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: By the grace of God if something happens to him i'll smite you down where you stand

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: Oh, he's just having a grand ol' time over there, that guy is a master, the best of the best at what he does I assure you

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Really? Oh my, I'll go have a look right now!

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: Haha, yeah, maybe later i'll take you, but let the kid have fun

Line3.name: Widow
Line3.dialogue: I'd very much like that, and your right, i'm just nervous is all

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: Haha, yeah, nervous, well, I'm off, gotta do... other stuff around, I'm off, bye!

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: Hes getting a tour of the train, you know how much he likes trains

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Is he now?

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: Well he hasn't passed through here yet, tell him to give a looksie down here, say hello to mama

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: Of course, of course (i HAVE to find him)

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: You aren't completely incompetent

Line1.name: Widow
Line1.dialogue: Thank you very much for finding my son

Line0.name: Widow
Line0.dialogue: So, what were you up to? I was worried

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: He was in the bathroom

Line2.name: Widow
Line2.dialogue: Weren't you now?

Line3.name: Child
Line3.dialogue: Yup, in the bathroom

Line4.name: Child
Line4.dialogue: He has been really nice to me, mama

Line8.name: Widow
Line8.dialogue: Kind man, you are quite good with children

Line9.name: Snowball
Line9.dialogue: I'll at the very least try very hard

Line0.name: Child
Line0.dialogue: Mama says that she wishes the train would just start already

Option0.Head: And what do you wish for?

Line0.name: Child
Line0.dialogue: I'm just happy to be on the train my daddy worked on

Line0.name: Child
Line0.dialogue: Hi!

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: What's your deal son?

Line2.name: Child
Line2.dialogue: I like trains and stories, and stories about trains

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: Do you now? I work on the railway myself

Line5.name: Child
Line5.dialogue: I'd love to work on a train when i'm older, just like my daddy did

Line7.name: Child
Line7.dialogue: he was super brave and cool, he would run on the roofs of trains to brake them, so they wouldn't crash

Line8.name: Child
Line8.dialogue: his job was very important, i bet i could do it too, just wait and see when i'm older

Option0.Head: And where's your dad now? He sounds cool

Line0.name: Child
Line0.dialogue: Oh, umm...

Line0.name: Child
Line0.dialogue: 10 and a half! Why?

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Yep, your a wee lad still, your in perfect age to start working if you really want to

Line2.name: Child
Line2.dialogue: my mama says i'm still to small for that

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: that you are

Line0.name: Child
Line0.dialogue: Trains are cool

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: hi mister old cat sir, mama says you look nice

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: Tell her that so does she, but guess what son

Option0.Head: I recently made an new friend

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: a future big name writer, he wants you to be the first to hear his stories

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: yeah right, with whom if i may ask?

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: with a future award winning novelist, and right now THE best story writer ever

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: he wants you to be the first boy, girl, man, woman, or thing ever to hear his new stories

Line0.name: Snowball
Line0.dialogue: that piece of garbage just jumped from the train and left us downhill to crash

Line1.name: Child
Line1.dialogue: what are we going to do?

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: we're gonna have to brake it

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: i'll need your help, you stop half and i'll stop the other half

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: we'll need to do it quickly, let's go

Option1.Head: Help me with your mama and i'll consider us even

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: I don't think I need to do much

Line.name: Child
Line.dialogue: She's already very fond of you

Line0.dialogue: When will this infernal train finally start moving?

Line1.dialogue: Someone should go wake up the man who makes the train go choo choo

Option0.Head: I'll wait with you right here

Option1.Head: I'm on my way over there right now

Line0.dialogue: I mean someone without depression
you sir are a true hero, i'll write my next story about you

Line1.name: Writer
Line1.dialogue: it'll be a homage so wonderfull that all my readers will know your name!

Line2.name: Writer
Line2.dialogue: try and come back after

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: I'll sure try

Line0.name: Writer
Line0.dialogue: Well hello everyday hero

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: So your a writer? have i read anything of yours?

Line2.name: Writer
Line2.dialogue: I don't think so, unless you really like childrens books

Line3.name: Writer
Line3.dialogue: But i'm on my way of writing my novel, so be sure to read it when it comes out

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: I'll be sure to do that

Line6.name: Writer
Line6.dialogue: I have to put food on the table somehow while i write my novel

Line7.name: Writer
Line7.dialogue: If that means humiliating myself by writing for children, then by the grace of God it shall be

Line8.name: Snowball
Line8.dialogue: So you don't like what you do?

Line0.name: Writer
Line0.dialogue: Hey hero

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Hello there, you know, there's a kid on board who seems nice, and really likes trains

Line2.name: Snowball
Line2.dialogue: He's quite sad looking right now, can i bring him over? you tell him a story and cheer him up, that sort of thing

Line3.name: Writer
Line3.dialogue: I despise myself for what i do for a living, i should be writing novels

Line4.name: Writer
Line4.dialogue: I should be respected by literary scholars around the globe

Line5.name: Writer
Line5.dialogue: But instead i write books for children because my novels don't circulate

Line6.name: Writer
Line6.dialogue: And now you want me to be some sort of jester for a child

Option0.Head: Don't think of it as that, consider it more focus group of your future readers

Option1.Head: Come on man, he's like REALLY sad

Line.name: Snowball
Line.dialogue: Feed him some simplified ideas and see what happens

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: Fine, i'll test some stuff with him, send him over when ever

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: So am i, and nobody gives me sympathy, only ridicule

Line.name: Writer
Line.dialogue: But fine, i'll help the kid out

Line0.name: Writer
Line0.dialogue: Well look at that, you did bring him

Line1.name: Writer
Line1.dialogue: You ready to listen to my genius?

Line2.name: Child
Line2.dialogue: I think i will be the judge of that

Line3.name: Snowball
Line3.dialogue: Are you good here little man?

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: I can stay if you want

Line5.name: Child
Line5.dialogue: I'm good, you can go do other stuff if you want

Line6.name: Snowball
Line6.dialogue: You can take care of him right?

Line7.name: Writer
Line7.dialogue: Of course, i'll just send him out the door and in your direction once i'm gone

Line0.name: Writer
Line0.dialogue: I really really liked that young man

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Quite a smart lad isn't he?

Line2.name: Writer
Line2.dialogue: That he sure is

Line3.name: Writer
Line3.dialogue: Anything else you needed?

Line4.name: Snowball
Line4.dialogue: Oh i just came for the boy, his mother started to get nervous

Line6.name: Writer
Line6.dialogue: I sent him off a while ago

Line8.name: Snowball
Line8.dialogue: His mother will have my head

Line9.name: Writer
Line9.dialogue: I saw him leave my wagon, after that i'm lost

Option0.Head: I'll have to tell his mother, maybe she has an idea of were he could be

Option1.Head: His mother can't know this, i'll have to hurry and make something up

Line0.name: Writer
Line0.dialogue: I guess now your a real hero

Line1.name: Snowball
Line1.dialogue: Not even close, but you still owe a story to my name, make it interisting now

Line2.name: Writer
Line2.dialogue: I'll try and do you justice
